properties.name: User Management
properties.tagline: Control user sessions, duration, timeouts and account sharing.

sections.title: User Session Management
summary: Purpose - Allows you to better control user sessions on your site and expire idle sessions and prevent account sharing.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Password Policies
summary: Purpose - Have full control over passwords used by users on the site.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: User Registration
summary: Purpose - Control user registration and prevent SPAM.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Automatic And Manual User Suspension
summary: Purpose - Automatically suspend accounts to prevent login by certain users.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Admin Login Notification
summary: Purpose - So you can be made aware of when a WordPress administrator has logged into your site when you are not expecting it.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Enable Module: User Management
summary: Purpose - User Management offers real user sessions, finer control over user session time-out, and ensures users have logged-in in a correct manner.
Recommendation - Keep the User Management feature turned on.

options.name: Enable User Management
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The User Management module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the User Management module

options.name: User Login Notification Email
options.summary: Send Email Notification To Each User Upon Successful Login
options.description: A notification is sent to each user when a successful login occurs for their account.

options.name: Admin Login Notification Email
options.summary: Send An Notification Email When Administrator Logs In
options.description: If you would like to be notified every time an administrator user logs into this WordPress site, enter a notification email address. No email address - No Notification.

options.name: Session Timeout
options.summary: Specify How Many Days After Login To Automatically Force Re-Login
options.description: WordPress default is 2 days, or 14 days if you check the 'Remember Me' box.

options.name: Idle Timeout
options.summary: Specify How Many Hours After Inactivity To Automatically Logout User
options.description: If the user is inactive for the number of hours specified, they will be forcefully logged out next time they return. Set this to '0' to turn off this option.

options.name: Lock To Location
options.summary: Locks A User Session To IP address
options.description: When selected, a session is restricted to the same IP address as when the user logged in. If a logged-in user's IP address changes, the session will be invalidated and they'll be forced to re-login to WordPress.

options.name: Max Simultaneous Sessions
options.summary: Limit Simultaneous Sessions For The Same Username
options.description: The number provided here is the maximum number of simultaneous, distinct, sessions allowed for any given username. Use '0' for no limits.

options.name: Validate Email Addresses
options.summary: Validate Email Addresses When User Attempts To Register
options.description: Validate Email Addresses When User Attempts To Register.

options.name: Email Checks
options.summary: The Email Address Properties That Will Be Tested

options.name: Prevent Pwned Passwords
options.description: Prevents users from using any passwords found on the public available list of pwned passwords.

options.name: Minimum Strength
options.description: All passwords that a user sets must meet this minimum strength.

options.name: Password Expiration
options.summary: Passwords Expire After This Many Days
options.description: Users will be forced to reset their passwords after the number of days specified.

options.name: Apply To Existing Users
options.summary: Apply Password Policies To Existing Users and Their Passwords
options.description: Forces existing users to update their passwords if they don't meet requirements, after they next login .

options.name: Allow Manual User Suspension
options.summary: Manually Suspend User Accounts To Prevent Login
options.description: Users may be suspended by administrators to prevent login.

options.name: Auto-Suspend Expired Passwords
options.summary: Automatically Suspend Users With Expired Passwords
options.description: Suspend login by users and require password reset to unsuspend.

options.name: Auto-Suspend Idle Users
options.description: Prevent login by idle users and require password reset to unsuspend.

options.name: Auto-Suspend Idle Users
options.description: Prevent login by idle users and require password reset to unsuspend.
